intro: Toumeya macrochele f. polaskii, commonly known as the Polaski's broad-leaved lily, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment.
